lines.text: Which Wright Brother did you buy this plane from?

[sarcastic]
Probably the one you dated in high school.
Oh, that's reassuring. We have a funny pilot.
Be careful! Some of the big fish can swallow you whole.
Swallow my what? You're not helping.
There's no such thing as too late. That's why they invented death.

[to Gil Godwyn while in the lifeboat]
/Listen to me, you sniveling little brown-nose. I have lived for 71 years, I've fought a war, I've buried my wife and I've survived 48 white sales at Gimble's. So if you think a little fop like you is gonna stop me, you've got another think coming!
[Herb and Charlie have successfully left the ship in the lifeboat]

[furiously]
I hope your boat capsizes and you drown like bloody rats!
Bye!
[Ellen Carruthers walks in at this point]
When that old bag makes me VP, I'll see to it you two never work on a cruise ship again as long as you LIVE!
[turns around, sees Ellen]

[shocked, but tries to save face]
Good evening, Ellen.
[Ellen heard Gil's rant]
You know, Gil. I never believed it but it's true. You really *are* an asshole!

[flustered]
I was simply doing my job.
Oh, you have no job. You're fired. Mac, as of now, you're my new CD.

[as Ellen starts to leave]
What about *me*?

[pointing to Mac]
You're... his friend.
[leaves]
[Mac and Jonathan turn on Gil]
[Mac has replaced Gil as the Cruise Director]
What's she talking about?
She's talking about "Button that button, you little prick!"
[leaves]
Prick.
[leaves]
[Gil stands there, still in shock]

[Charlie fakes a fall onto the deck to hide from Gil spotting him fraternizing with Liz]
Oh, what's the matter? Are you all right?
An old football injury.
College?
No, professional. The Jets blew a 30-point lead against the Dolphins. I tried to throw my TV set out the window.
We're not working. We're dancing and cavorting.
a song-and-dance man raised on a military base.
I saw the way you were looking at my daughter's chest.
I used to be a cardiologist.
I've got my eye on you, Gordon.
You're not so bad yourself! Heh! Heh! Heh!
I need a crap and a nap and I don't need an audience!"
Look at the size of this room! A good fart will give you a concussion!
[after seeing their cabin]
Cozy? A good fart will give you a concussion!
Listen, I'm not authorized to throw your ass over board, but I will!
With an ass so beautiful, it's a shame she has to sit down on it.
I'm waiting for my sexual prime.
And just when do you think that's gonna happen?
[Charlie looks at watch. She laughs]

[Sniffing Charles]
Is that cologne, or Armor All?
That's close, close. It's cologne, but I bought it at a gas station.
I'll tell you the truth, Gil, I lost my wife not too long ago...
Oh, good. Good! Tell it to the ladies. They eat it up.
We shall have to call the Guinness Book of Records about your friend Charlie.
What? Now what?
Oh, he's taking the longest piss in freaking recorded history
Why are you sterilizing your trousers?

[Annoyed]
I'm *steaming* them.
Oh, then what are you gonna' do, eat 'em with garlic butter?
It takes the wrinkles out, you imbecile!
Huh! When a man is steaming his pants at midnight, it generally means there's a broad.
No broad!
rich... "Texas rich." With an ass so beautiful, it's a shame she has to sit down on it.
Will you do me a favor and just knock that stuff off?
Oh, I'm sorry, I forgot you were cooking.
My husband was in the oil business with my dad. If daddy trusted him, I figured I could trust him, too.
So, what happened?
Well, as it turned out, there were a lot of test wells he was drillin' on the side.
Should've had him neutered.
Oh, I did, ha ha. Except I used an attorney instead of a doctor.

[Dancing with Charlie, who is extremely awkward]
What do you call this step?
This is called "the Brazilian Creep."
Oh?
In Brazil, of course, it's just called "the creep".

[Seeing Vivian entering the dance area]
So... it's the broad that stole our airplane seats.

[Annoyed]
That "broad" happens to have been an editor at Doubleday.
Who cares?
All I was, was a clerk at Gimbel's.
And Secretariat was just a horse. Go on, ask her to dance!
Oh, it's too late, Charlie.
There's no such thing as "too late". That's why they invented death!
Which one of the Wright brothers did you buy this from?
Probably the one you dated in high school.
Wooo! I feel so much better. That's very reassuring. We have a FUNNY pilot!
Liz... from the first moment I saw you on that ship... it was my intention to lie to you, I swear.
Well, *that's* sweet.
What I didn't intend, was falling in love with you.

[Seeing Charlie and Herb dancing together]
Don't ask, don't tell.
Hah! A couple of gold diggers, comin' up empty. That's terrific!
What do I look like, a schmuck?
The jury's still out on that one.
Shut up, ma. We're keepin' him.

[Last lines]
You're not getting' a nickel out of me, Charlie!
